title: Drawing, "Design for Textile-Inventory Card", 1952–69
medium: Purple and red colored pencil, graphite on white tracing paper drymounted on cardboard
inscribed:
Recto: in graphite upper left on mount above drawing: bracket and "1/96"; left side: bracket and "repeat";in center on mount: "warp" [arrow]; uper center: "satin" and "rep" with indicators on design; upper right corner: 4

Verso: in graphite upper left corner: II - 39; in graphite along right side:  8 motifs in 3 3/8 nearest
provenance: This collection was donated to the Cooper-Hewitt, National Design Museum in 1969 by Alexander Girard
description: Geometric pattern of diamonds and squares arranged in seven alternating dark and light rows

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for Textile-Inventory Card", 1952–69.
1952–69. Purple and red colored pencil, graphite on white tracing paper drymounted on cardboard. Gift of Alexander H. Girard. 1969-165-457.
